INTERNET and Web Resources for SAS Programmers and Statisticians

If you get a favorite site for SAS programmers or statisticians, please let us know by email at info@prochelp.com . If you'd like to receive SAS tips and news, please sign up our newsletter by email at newsletter@prochelp.com with the word "subscribe" in the subject line.
If you are looking for SAS programmers or statisticians, or if you are looking for job opportunities, or you have some SAS related events to announce, please send them to news@prochelp.com .

Updated: April 11, 2006  Search for a position in statistics Acandidate respectively earned a Master's degree in Pure Mathematics, a Master's degree in Applied Mathematics with a concentration in Statistics at the University of North Florida, and a Ph.D. degree in Statistics at the University of South Florida. For more than seven years he has been conducting research in statistics.

For resume, please contact news@prochelp.com Source -- news@prochelp.com Updated: March 23, 2006  Job Opportunity Judge Technical Services seeks two (2) Senior SAS Clinical Programmers (10+ years experience) with knowledge of Web Interfaces and experience with SAS Integrated Technologies (v9.13). Will assist with developing web interfaces and reports using SAS; also responsible for collecting data, developing and modifying reports based on the Statistical Development Plan. Must have experience creating table listings and creating macros from scratch. Required: Strong understanding of protocol development, SAS programming for Clinical Trials, Validation, 21CFR Part 11 Location: Pearl River, NY (Rockland County) Applicants interested in this and other positions should contact: Eden Blum 732.497.4256 eblum@judge.com Eden J. Blum Technical Recruiter Judge Technical Staffing office: 732-497-4256 888-228-7165 x4256 fax:     732-346-9101 www.judge.com eblum@judge.com Source -- Eden J. Blum (eblum@judge.com) Updated: February 16, 2006  Book Review: Sharpening Your SAS Skills by Sunil Gupta and Curt Edmonds Book Review: Sharpening Your SAS Skills by Sunil Gupta and Curt Edmonds Chapman & Hall/CRC Press: ISBN: 1584885017 This book is worth reading by all levels of SAS programmers but especially for the Beginner up to the
Intermediate Levels. You should have some experience using the SAS software before picking up this
book. It provides concise explanations, helpful examples and a nice summary section at the end of all six
chapters with the added benefit of some comprehensive questions with answers provided at the end of the
book. Another added feature of this book for those who have not used SAS V9 or V8, is a section on the
enhancements to these two SAS versions which should be helpful to those who have not had much
experience with the new enhancements. In reading this book, Iuncovered a few new features of SAS that Iwas unaware of and immediately
thought of where Icould utilize these new features and began employing them in my new code.
This book is NOT intended to be a reference manual but the 273 pages can easily be read over several
days and is helpful as a refresher course to reinforce your basic knowledge of SAS. It also provides a
great presentation and explanation on the PDV which Ihave not found in other books by SAS users.
This is a book worth having in your SAS library to share with the rest of your staff who use the SAS
Software. Charles Patridge Sr. Data Engineer Full Capture Solutions. Source -- GuptaProgramming@cs.com
